newsitem.title: USA: United Waste files $150 mln shelf. [CORRECTED 15:54 GMT 1/1]
newsitem.headline: United Waste files $150 mln shelf. [CORRECTED 15:54 GMT 1/1]

text.p: United Waste Systems Inc said Tuesday it filed a shelf registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $150 million in debt securities, preferred and common stock and warrants.

The net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, which may include acquisitions, refinancing of indebtedness, working capital, capital expenditures and repurchases or redemption of securities.

The Greenwich, Conn., company owns or operates 13 nonhazardous landfills, 10 waste collection companies and 14 transfer stations located in Michigan, Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, West Virginia, Kentucky and Mississippi.
